Subject: AdaptiveRevisitFrontier

Hello there, 

I am running a heritrix 2.0.2 installation here without major problems
so far.

But now I was given the task to crawl some sites periodically, a job
which I thought Heritrix' AdaptiveRevisitFrontier would do quite nicely. 

But unfortunatly I found that this module is br0ken in the 2.0.2
release. 
Bugs include: 
  * The Frontier does not implement Initializable, therefore
    initialTasks is never executed
  * The Frontier needs a SheetManager
  * many more. I fixed all i encountered so far, but am currently stuck
    a bug when writing to the BDB. 

The frontier does not inherit from AbstractFrontier, a whole lot of code
from it seems to have been copied from there.

is there any other way to do this? I need almost exactly what
AdaptiveRevisitFrontier promised to me: Repetively crawl a list of urls
and schedule the next crawl of an url according to the result of the
last crawl performed. 

greetings from Germany

Stefan

--
